title.label: Shameful lack of support for newer phones.

content.label: A game of this caliber and no support for full screen on X?

Really enjoyed the artwork and different monsters..very unique. The constant back and forth swiping did get a bit old and tiring at times but I‚Äôll still give it five stars. With the utter lack of decent games available on iOS I was pleasantly surprised how much fun I had playing this one.
I haven‚Äôt been playing this game for very long, and it is creepy and amazing. Five stars!

When I first bought this game I didn‚Äôt think much of it, but after playing through the full thing, I would say that it is a true work of art. The storytelling, imagery and music help to make a great work of art.

Got it for just about two bucks and saw it‚Äôs only about 200 megabytes so I thought it‚Äôs gonna be another D&D (download & delete).. when I first started playing I thought it was like a primitive copy of Infinity Blade (slashing).. then I thought it‚Äôs a primitive copy of Dark Meadow (discovering).. when I got deeper and deeper I came to realize the true unique nature and depth of the game.. the depth of seemingly shallow graphics, depth of story, depth of themes, depth of making.. it‚Äôs really well made.. I have a hard taste and I say this game is great.

The bird with two heads got my eyes wet at the end and I just want to say to it thanks for all the help buddy I wish you all the best üôè‚úåÔ∏èüëã

title.label: Easy to play, difficult to master

content.label: Would have given it 5/5 but I think the swipe finishes need to be a little less precise.  Still fun and creepy game.
I absolutely enjoyed this game but it did freeze when I was fighting the dragon and had to start over again

Severed really takes advantage of the touch screen interface and the story is interesting. Overall, the game is simply better than almost anything on mobile which makes since because it was designed for portable gaming systems like PlayStation Vita and Nintendo Switch.

I‚Äôm a console gamer and dubious of finding a mobile game that I would enjoy as much as a game on my Switch or PS4. This one made me a believer! Awesome. Felt like a little Zelda, a little GOW and a lot of fun. Dark tone. Great art design.
Good game, but not enjoyable when half of the screen is black bars.

I wouldn‚Äôt call this game a revolutionary work of art, but it‚Äôs environment, story, and monster design provide a fascinating experience difficult to replicate. The environment leaves you wondering where on earth you are, and what on earth happened here. And to top if off, there‚Äôs the mystery of where your family has gotten off to; the combines mystery should be enough to keep you playing.

The combat isn‚Äôt complicated, but it‚Äôs not easy, either. Combat in this game is about time management; you‚Äôll face a number of monsters at once, and you‚Äôll have to do as much damage as you can while blocking their attacks. However, you‚Äôll have to be careful not to kill any of them until your focus meter fills up, or you‚Äôll loose out on valuable parts.

It‚Äôs not expensive, and I suggest you pick it up when you have the chance. You won‚Äôt regret it; even if you decide you don‚Äôt like the game, you won‚Äôt have lost a great deal of money.

This is my favorite phone game so far! The developers are all geniuses (aside from the one that decided to create the battle on the Mountain Summit clouds. Yes, you - you know who you are üòè)

Edit:
The specific battle stated above is ridiculously hard compared to the rest of the battles and it‚Äôs almost impossible to win if you have an iPhone X/XS because the developers haven‚Äôt updated it so that it needs 2 swipes from the bottom to close the app and return to the home screen, so when you try to make long and fast swipes to kill the monsters in this tight time limit, you end up suspending the app and losing all that precious time ugh...

The art, music, and play style all come together in this colorful, unnerving experience.  It‚Äôs sort of a blend of old school D&D PC games like Eye of the Beholder, mixed with some Ocarina of a Time kind of puzzles, and Metroid-vania backtracking and exploration.  A satisfying game to play, solve, and conquer.
New 10/14 update doesn‚Äôt work on iPhone Xs. White bar to close program always showing. Hard to press ply on home screen. Gets stuck on the character upgrade screen. Please fix!
Doesn‚Äôt work on my brand new iPad Pro, wth just waisted 7 dollars on literally nothing. DO NOT BUY

Honestly this has been the most fun I‚Äôve had playing a game in a long time! The pseudo turn based dungeon crawling gave me time to soak in the atmosphere but kept me anxious to keep going. Level design was perfect and art style was breathtaking and highly engaging. Heavily emotional story focusing on coping with loss and pushing through pain. 

I love the Lovecraftian influence on the world and the monsters, and the subtle hints at lore were very thought provoking. I would absolutely kill for a sequel, or another game taking place in the same universe. Thanks so much for this game, it was a well needed distraction!! üòÅüëç

This game has an amazing style that blows me away for a phone game. It is very addicting to play and challenging at some points. This will leave you at the edge of your seat fighting off unique monsters. Through out this game I have been lifted off my feet from its raw amazement. If you want a quality game to enjoy, this is it. 

Severed.

Thank you.

This is my new favorite game. It‚Äôs creepy, but not too creepy that you stop playing it. Severed is the best game I‚Äôve played.If there was an option to give 100 stars, I would totally do that.‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
I rate this game 5 stars because the story is amazing, and the gameplay isn‚Äôt boring like most other mobile games with repeating combat systems. I loved every moment of this game.

I loved this game so much. I love how the combat is based off of your movement and I love how the story can really get to you and make you feel multiple emotions. Please make another severed but with different characters and a whole new storyline. Or you can just keep Sasha!

This game is immensely enjoyable. It gets a bit old to tab around rooms if you tap a little off but everything else about this game is simply fun. The story is also on point by spreading it out through the game play and keeping it brief. Good bet you won‚Äôt regret this purchase.

title.label: Great Experience, but it‚Äôs missing something...

content.label:
To put it simply, Severed is a crazed adventure where you as the player control Sasha, a lost child searching for her family. In your adventure, you will encounter several threats and obstacles that keep you from reaching them. So the lore is cut short, but lore is unnecessary for the type of game that is this Severed, so I won‚Äôt give it a rating.
[-/10]

The combat in Severed starts simple and build on itself over time. The game can be played on Casual and Standard, which alter the difficulty of enemies. The creatures you encounter will all possess different patterns that evolve as the game progresses, and the main way to defeat them is to manage cooldowns and attack when the time is right; however, this combat loop can feel overwhelming at times, especially at the high difficulties. Without spoiling anything, the bosses in the game feel powerful, but possible to take down. All of them have unique attacks and are worth the time it takes to reach them.
[9/10]

Exploration in Severed starts bright, but the light dwindles in the mid to late game. There are unique puzzles and obstacles to pass, most of them being fairly simple, but once it does get more difficult, the exploration becomes more tedious. It just feels like downtime between encounters, which, in my opinion, are where the game shines most, not the exploration.
[6.5/10]

Out of all aspects of this game, the replay-ability is where it falls flat. The game is a great experience (challenging if you are on Standard mode), but after the game is complete for the first time, it is hard to keep playing. The incentive is supposed to be the secrets that must be walked to from across the map. The secrets include more rewards and harder challenges past the end-game, but it wasn‚Äôt enough to keep me going. I suggest that Severed gets a new mode after the game is completed, like an endless mode. I think the combat is refined and polished, and a mode that incentivizes players to keep playing for the combat seems like a good path forward. Overall, Severed‚Äôs replay-ability is lacking, and that‚Äôs the most important thing in a game.
[3.5/10]

After all those negatives, you would think I wouldn‚Äôt advise purchasing this game, but the experience is too rich to pass up. There is just enough depth to keep the player thinking and engaging in the ‚Äúwonderful‚Äù world that is Severed.
[8/10] Strongly Recommended!

I took a chance on severed, and now I will say so should you. The puzzles are the right amount of challenging, and the visuals and soundtrack are hauntingly brilliant. It takes the slashing mechanics of games like fruit ninja and accents it with a well-made set of lite RPG skill trees and an interesting story. Its kept me entertained for a while now, and there are things in each area that you can go back and explore later for increased replay value. Highly recommended.
An ever-exciting gameplay; unique mechanics amazingly adapted to a mobile game, intriguing puzzles that keep you playing, and a truly awesome soundtrack.

This game took me six hours to play. It‚Äôs not a sit through once because it can get frustrating when you keep dying (but that may be just me because I‚Äôm not great at slashing!) but the story is great, and the challenges get harder as you move along.
The graphics are really good and the bosses, enemy, and special magic power stuff are good well done Drinkbox Studios!üòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄ

Despite largely positive critical reviews, I have avoided this game for a couple of years now, but now that I have played it through, I am glad I changed my mind. Despite detractors suggesting it was overly simplistic and monotonous, I found it refreshing and rich throughout. Despite necessary backtracking I never felt bored, and despite at times it being unevenly challenging, it never felt punishing. There did seem to be an even-handedness in the developers game architecture, in which they sought a balance between difficulty and accomplishment, never spoon feeding but also not sending you naked into a burning obstacle course either! 
My only complaint is that replay-ability seems low, based on the fact that in order to defeat the final boss, I already acquired all of the upgrades and items. Maybe again in a year or so. Kudos!

title.label: Fun enough for a second play through

content.label: Awesome scenery and fun game play. I redownloaded it after a bit and it's just as good.

This game perfectly captures many things from my favorite games! Any InfinityBlade games have the picking up bags of money that are lying around, also, the way you fight (like you fight in infinityblade) is spectacular. And then the Zelda like puzzles! They are awesome! The switches, keys (by keys I mean the mouth things). The fact that you can smash open the pots and it gives you giblets is awesome! The art in this game and the creepy parts are also great, this game has the best art I have ever seen.
I never thought I would enjoy any kind of action game on mobile devices. But this game is just amazing and easy to play. Quite enjoying it.

A great game and well worth he money I spent on it. Some of the  combat near the end does feel a bit repetitive but other than that the developers did a amazing job. It‚Äôs perfect in every sense that I can think of. The music (and lack of sometimes) is amazing and well thought out.
I just finish crow island God bless this game

title.label: Interesting title with little substance and terrible direction

content.label:
Very cool premise and neat art design. Dig the layout of the story. This game had a lot of potential.

Gameplay is extremely shallow and repetitive. You will fight the same 5-6 types of enemies the whole game with varying strengths and buffs, solve the same puzzles over and over again, and that‚Äôs that - end of game.

Game suffers a lot on iPhone X due to its swipe nature and the fact it wants you to do wide swipes for more damage. Swiping vertically therefore is better than horizontally as the travel time is shorter, yet if you swipe up from too low you will minimize the app and if you swipe down from too high you bring down the apple overlay. There is one fight in this game that is borderline impossible due to its very tight window of time and how easy it is to flub wide swipes.

That mixed with the general architecture of its unique yet ultimately annoying combat system leaves this at 2 out of 5 stars. Swipe games can be done much better than this.
It‚Äôs been quite a while since I was completely absorbed in a game like I was with Severed. Totally awesome. Wish there was a sequel!
One of the best games I‚Äôve played. Cannot WAIT for the sequel!!!!
The best iOS game of all time
on the X there the black lines of the smaller screen, i bought this game cause i thought it was updated for the X, please fix

Such a good game & definitely worth the price. I was absolutely hooked on the mesmerizing graphics, creepy story, fun battles, and everything overall. Would recommend to anyone looking for a fun and memorable game!
Game is great but not something I want to play when it's not optimized for the X.
Great story, beautiful art style ruined for me by its mechanic systemüôÅ
You can play this game for an hour or play in 5 minutes sprints. It was so well made and has a solid storyline along with it. Very fun gameplay and I would highly recommend it.
A fantastic dungeon crawler. Buy it.
Loved this game. Visually stunning. Original battle dynamic and creep cool story line.

I am, without a doubt, thoroughly impressed. This is unsettling and extremely morbid, used in such a tasteful way that i cant help being drawn back to it. The gameplay changes enough to keep it interesting; I don't find myself getting bored. Absolutely stunning effects, story, and atmosphere. Never seen anything like it. Truly a work of art, worth every penny.

title.label: I‚Äôm picky about games...but this is brilliant.

content.label: I‚Äôm tempted to go back and dock a star from every game review I‚Äôve ever given. This is the only game I‚Äôve played that‚Äôs truly worth the stars and the money. Beautiful graphics, fantastic plot, amazing world-building, good gameplay, and it takes enough time to complete so I feel I got my money‚Äôs worth. I‚Äôd gladly have paid more for this game.

title.label: No iPhone X support even when patch notes indicate such

content.label: Bought the game since it had iPhone X support. When I launched the app it did NOT use the full screen. I feel like I was taken advantage of =/

This game was fantastic! I only wish there were sequels with perhaps different stories in this crazy vivid world to play through! I payed like five bucks for this game, this is coming from someone who only downloads free apps typically so it‚Äôs a big deal and I feel like there should be more to it considering I beat this game in a matter of days.
There is no way this game is being rated highly. For whatever reason, Apple is purging low rated reviews. A complete waste of money
This game is absolutely fantastic! Challenging and compelling with the story line, loved every minute!
